KH.content: khōra never reached, broached [entamer?], touched, exhausted: not subject, not subjectile
KH.linkedContent: khōra never reached, broached [entamer?], touched, exhausted: not subject, not subjectile

KH.content: a virginity rebellious against anthropomorphism, not order of eidos or mimemes
KH.linkedContent: a virginity rebellious against anthropomorphism, not order of eidos or mimemes

AF.content: can one imagine an archive w/out foundation, w/out substance, w/out subjectile?
AF.linkedContent: can one imagine an archive w/out foundation, w/out substance, w/out subjectile?

AF.content: the archaic impression Freud seeks almost no longer an archive, confuses itself w/ a footstep that leaves its still living mark on surface, place of origin, when step still one w/ subjectile
AF.linkedContent: the archaic impression Freud seeks almost no longer an archive, confuses itself w/ a footstep that leaves its still living mark on surface, place of origin, when step still one w/ subjectile

MSUBJ.content: subjectile: not an object of knowing
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile: not an object of knowing

MSUBJ.content: btwn sub and tile [the “-ject”]: persecuting evils, haunting the supports, substrata, substances > Artaud never stopped exorcising, conjuring the fiends (suppôts), succubi, sorcerers
MSUBJ.linkedContent: btwn sub and tile [the “-ject”]: persecuting evils, haunting the supports, substrata, substances > Artaud never stopped exorcising, conjuring the fiends (suppôts), succubi, sorcerers

MSUBJ.content: subjectile is everything distinct from form, from sense & representation, skin w/holes for pores [Irigaray] > “its presumed depth or thickness can only be seen as a surface,” a flat succubi
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile is everything distinct from form, from sense & representation, skin w/holes for pores [Irigaray] > “its presumed depth or thickness can only be seen as a surface,” a flat succubi

MSUBJ.content: the 2 classes of subjectile: 1) porous like wood, paper, permits itself to be traversed 2) metals, alloys, permits no passage
MSUBJ.linkedContent: the 2 classes of subjectile: 1) porous like wood, paper, permits itself to be traversed 2) metals, alloys, permits no passage

MSUBJ.content: subjectile’s secret should only be shared w/ the translator: that it is untranslatable.
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile’s secret should only be shared w/ the translator: that it is untranslatable.

MSUBJ.content: subjectile embodies the paradox of excess (does it or does it not belong to language?)
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile embodies the paradox of excess (does it or does it not belong to language?)

MSUBJ.content: a mime would say we have to be done w/ subjectile, and he wouldn’t be wrong, it’s a judgment of God, we are spectators of it, “having done with it, interminably”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: a mime would say we have to be done w/ subjectile, and he wouldn’t be wrong, it’s a judgment of God, we are spectators of it, “having done with it, interminably”

MSUBJ.content: subjectile is consistency of btwn itself
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile is consistency of btwn itself

MSUBJ.content: subjectile: “we won’t ever speak of it if to speak of means to speak of objects or subjects”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile: “we won’t ever speak of it if to speak of means to speak of objects or subjects”

MSUBJ.content: to meet back up with innate nature (in-né), must force the subjectile, rendering it mad from birth, desiring birth
MSUBJ.linkedContent: to meet back up with innate nature (in-né), must force the subjectile, rendering it mad from birth, desiring birth

MSUBJ.content: subjectile interposes itself as the hymen btwn inside & outside, finally becoming the jetée (the spurt, a spurt like a fallen stone, dead) > objective, subjective, projectile, introjection, objection, dejection, abjection
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile interposes itself as the hymen btwn inside & outside, finally becoming the jetée (the spurt, a spurt like a fallen stone, dead) > objective, subjective, projectile, introjection, objection, dejection, abjection

MSUBJ.content: subjectile, btwn 2 places, the subject become a gisant, spread out, stretched out, inert, neutral (ci-gît) [see C p. 234 ci-gît, “here lies”]
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile, btwn 2 places, the subject become a gisant, spread out, stretched out, inert, neutral (ci-gît) [see C p. 234 ci-gît, “here lies”]

MSUBJ.content: subjectile is the forceful throwing, casting and also what has to be traversed, pierced, the membrane, the paper > “the trajectory of what’s thrown upon it” dynamizes the skin in perforating it, passing to other side: “after having exploded the wall of the problem” [hymen]
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile is the forceful throwing, casting and also what has to be traversed, pierced, the membrane, the paper > “the trajectory of what’s thrown upon it” dynamizes the skin in perforating it, passing to other side: “after having exploded the wall of the problem” [hymen]

MSUBJ.content: neither/nor of subjectile (neither subservient nor dominating) situates place of a double constraint (both screen & projectile) > becomes unrepresentable
MSUBJ.linkedContent: neither/nor of subjectile (neither subservient nor dominating) situates place of a double constraint (both screen & projectile) > becomes unrepresentable

MSUBJ.content: everything played out btwn transitivity of throwing and intransitivity of being-thrown
MSUBJ.linkedContent: everything played out btwn transitivity of throwing and intransitivity of being-thrown

MSUBJ.content: motion of motif, w/out totalization, subjectilian wall: “of this dissociation in the body of which there will always be marked the singularity of the event made work”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: motion of motif, w/out totalization, subjectilian wall: “of this dissociation in the body of which there will always be marked the singularity of the event made work”

MSUBJ.content: to speak of the subjectile, we must speak by insertion and precipitation, acceleration of rhythmical projection [see MPM p. 62] and inscription of projectile, beyond “words and images”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: to speak of the subjectile, we must speak by insertion and precipitation, acceleration of rhythmical projection [see MPM p. 62] and inscription of projectile, beyond “words and images”

TR.content: band, ribbon, silk, double bind en soie, ringhband, phantasmatic body on which limited ink (finite reserve) is made to flow; ink remains modest but capitalizes, virtually lets flow
TR.linkedContent: band, ribbon, silk, double bind en soie, ringhband, phantasmatic body on which limited ink (finite reserve) is made to flow; ink remains modest but capitalizes, virtually lets flow

TR.content: ribbon: subjectile on which one writes & piece of machine thanks to which one will never have done w/ inscribing [all this deconstructs de Man’s claim the “ribbon” is a “free signifier’]
TR.linkedContent: ribbon: subjectile on which one writes & piece of machine thanks to which one will never have done w/ inscribing [all this deconstructs de Man’s claim the “ribbon” is a “free signifier’]

TR.content: “I beseech you” not to “annihilate” [re: Confessions]: performative eve, arche-peformative before performative, younger & older, support & archive of confession
TR.linkedContent: “I beseech you” not to “annihilate” [re: Confessions]: performative eve, arche-peformative before performative, younger & older, support & archive of confession

TR.content: its subjectile, very body of event, archival and auto-deictic body
TR.linkedContent: its subjectile, very body of event, archival and auto-deictic body

TR.content: revelation of truth nothing w/out saving body of inscriptions
TR.linkedContent: revelation of truth nothing w/out saving body of inscriptions

TR.content: due to unforeseeable, inappropriable exteriority, event is traumatic (a fearsome generality of “trauma”—there’s trauma of “happy” experience) > makes precarious distinction btwn point of view of subject & that which is produced independently of desire: event injures desire
TR.linkedContent: due to unforeseeable, inappropriable exteriority, event is traumatic (a fearsome generality of “trauma”—there’s trauma of “happy” experience) > makes precarious distinction btwn point of view of subject & that which is produced independently of desire: event injures desire

CIR.content: to those idiots who think computers are harmful to writing, I’ve nicknamed mine subjectile
CIR.linkedContent: to those idiots who think computers are harmful to writing, I’ve nicknamed mine subjectile
